==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|sort=らっこ|yomi=irr}}
{{bor|ja|ain|sort=らっこ|ラッコ|tr=rakko|t=otter}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The kanji spelling is from {{der|ja|sort=らっこ|zh|海獺}}, and is {{juku|sort=らっこ}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|らっこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|猟虎}}, {{l|ja|獺虎}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|らっこ|ラッコ}}

# a [[sea otter]]

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|ラッコ}}

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|獺|うそ}}: an [[otter]] {{qualifier|usually refers to a river otter, but can also refer to a sea otter; ''rakko'' is more common for a sea otter}}
* {{ja-r|川獺|かわうそ}}: a [[river]] [[otter]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|うみ|うそ|yomi=k}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=うみうそ|海|tr1=umi|t1=sea|獺|tr2=uso|t2=otter}};<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> see {{m|ja|川獺|tr=kawauso}}. Possibly from the superficial similarities between sea otters and (particularly young) sea lions.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うみうそ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うみうそ}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=うみうそ}} a [[sea lion]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|海驢|あしか}}, {{ja-r|葦鹿|あしか}}

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{m|ja|海驢|tr=ashika}} is much more common for the {{m|en|sea lion}} sense.

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|海豹|あざらし}}: a [[seal]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うみ|おそ}}
{{IPAchar|/umiwoso/}} → {{IPAchar|/umioso/}}

Rare variant of ''umiuso'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> May be the original form.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うみおそ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うみおそ|hhira=うみをそ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=うみおそ|rare}} a [[sea lion]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|かい|たつ|yomi=o}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かいたつ}} {{m|zh|海獺|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> that|lit=sea + otter}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''hoi<sup>2</sup> caat<sup>3</sup>''.

Note that the meaning diverged in Japanese from the original Chinese sense. See ''umiuso'' above for more.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|かいたつ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいたつ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かいたつ|rare|zoology}} a [[sea lion]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かいたつ|rare|zoology}} a [[seal]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|sea lion}} {{ja-r|海驢|あしか}}, {{ja-r|葦鹿|あしか}}
* {{sense|seal}} {{ja-r|海豹|あざらし}}

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{m|ja|海驢|tr=ashika}} is much more common for the {{m|en|sea lion}} sense. The term {{m|ja|海豹|tr=azarashi}} is much more common for the {{m|en|seal}} sense.

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|だつ}}
Rare variant of ''kaitatsu'' above, using the {{m|ja|慣用音|tr=kan'yōon}} of ''datsu'' for the {{m|ja|獺}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|かいだつ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいたつ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かいたつ|very|_|rare|zoology}} a [[sea lion]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かいたつ|very|_|rare|zoology}} a [[seal]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|sea lion}} {{ja-r|海驢|あしか}}, {{ja-r|葦鹿|あしか}}
* {{sense|seal}} {{ja-r|海豹|あざらし}}

=====Usage notes=====
The term {{m|ja|海驢|tr=ashika}} is much more common for the {{m|en|sea lion}} sense. The term {{m|ja|海豹|tr=azarashi}} is much more common for the {{m|en|seal}} sense.
